  1. from django.db import models
  2. from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _
  3. from cms.models import CMSPlugin
  4. import os
  5. from django.conf import settings
  7. class File(CMSPlugin):
  8. """
  9. Plugin for storing any type of file.
  11. Default template displays download link with icon (if available) and file size.
  13. Icons are searched for within <MEDIA_ROOT>/<CMS_FILE_ICON_PATH>
  14. (CMS_FILE_ICON_PATH is a plugin-specific setting which defaults to "<CMS_MEDIA_PATH>/images/file_icons")
  15. with filenames of the form <file_ext>.<icon_ext>, where <file_ext> is the extension
  16. of the file itself, and <icon_ext> is one of <CMS_FILE_ICON_EXTENSIONS>
  17. (another plugin specific setting, which defaults to ('gif', 'png'))
  19. This could be updated to use the mimetypes library to determine the type of file rather than
  20. storing a separate icon for each different extension.
  22. The icon search is currently performed within get_icon_url; this is probably a performance concern.
  23. """
  24. file = models.FileField(_("file"), upload_to=CMSPlugin.get_media_path)
  25. title = models.CharField(_("title"), max_length=255, null=True, blank=True)
  26. # CMS_ICON_EXTENSIONS and CMS_ICON_PATH are assumed to be plugin-specific, and not included in cms.settings
  27. # -- they are therefore imported from django.conf.settings
  28. ICON_EXTENSIONS = getattr(settings, "CMS_FILE_ICON_EXTENSIONS", ('gif', 'png'))
  29. ICON_PATH = getattr(settings, "CMS_FILE_ICON_PATH", os.path.join(settings.STATIC_ROOT, "cms", "images", "file_icons"))
  30. ICON_URL = getattr(settings, "CMS_FILE_ICON_URL", "%s%s/%s/%s/" % (settings.STATIC_URL, "cms", "images", "file_icons"))
  32. def get_icon_url(self):
  33. path_base = os.path.join(self.ICON_PATH, self.get_ext())
  34. url_base = '%s%s' % (self.ICON_URL, self.get_ext())
  35. for ext in self.ICON_EXTENSIONS:
  36. if os.path.exists("%s.%s" % (path_base, ext)):
  37. return "%s.%s" % (url_base, ext)
  38. return None
  40. def file_exists(self):
  41. return os.path.exists(self.file.path)
  43. def get_file_name(self):
  44. return os.path.basename(self.file.path)
  46. def get_ext(self):
  47. return os.path.splitext(self.get_file_name())[1][1:].lower()
  49. def __unicode__(self):
  50. if self.title:
  51. return self.title;
  52. elif self.file:
  53. # added if, because it raised attribute error when file wasnt defined
  54. return self.get_file_name();
  55. return "<empty>"
  57. search_fields = ('title',)
